intro: Jacquinia petiolata, commonly known as the slenderleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia petiolata is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments.
